result.execSummary:
The defendant Levester Shantalei Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Parenting classes.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved  contact.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

**Restitution is set at 0.**

Obtain and maintain employment.
Obtain GED or HSED.

timeConds.notes: Stayed pending a review on 12-11-2015 at 1:15 pm.

supervisions.notes:
Court orders that costs, assessments and fees imposed in count 2 be paid during term of probation.

Court orders all costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during probation in count 1.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Levester Shantalei Jones in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
At request of Probation agent Jessica Lorum, review is re-set to 1-8-2016 at 1:15.

Defendant Levester Shantalei Jones in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Statements to the court by parties.
As to count 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12-11-2015 at 1:15pm.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling .
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.  Parenting classes.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved  contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Court orders that costs, assessments and fees imposed in count 2 be paid during term of probation.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment. Obtain GED or HSED.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution is set at 0.
As to count 2:  Court sentences defendant to 1 day House of Correction, a time served disposition.  Court orders all costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during probation in count 1.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Levester Shantalei Jones in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO CHARGES: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 8-19-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse..All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Levester Shantalei Jones in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All the discovery has been received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 6-24-2015 at 8:30 am .  Offer will remain open until 6-17-2015, per the State.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with named parties on the complaint and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld  Jury trial scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Levester Shantalei Jones in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-3-2015 at 8:30am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: AMANDA A; L.J.(3/2/07 );  L.J. (2/10/12);  L.J. (10/13/10).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Levester Shantalei Jones in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Levester Shantalei Jones in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
